      • sortListByName

        public void sortListByName​(javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> list,
                           javafx.scene.control.ListView<java.lang.String> listView,
                           int order)
        Sorts files/directories by name, either ascending or descending - based on the 'order' param.
        Parameters:
        list - - observableArrayList which is given as parameter to newly created SortedList
        listView - - listView to be later given sorted items.
        order - - order, 1 for descending, -1 for ascending

      • sortListByDate

        public void sortListByDate​(javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> list,
                           javafx.scene.control.ListView<java.lang.String> listView,
                           java.nio.file.Path path,
                           java.nio.file.Path anotherPath,
                           int order)
        Sorts files/directories by date/time, either ascending or descending - based on the 'order' param.
        Parameters:
        list - - observableArrayList which is given as parameter to newly created SortedList
        listView - - listView to be later given sorted items.
        path - - path to left side directory
        anotherPath - - path to right side directory
        order - - order, 1 for descending, -1 for ascending

      • leftSortBy

        public void leftSortBy()
        Sorts left area directory based on selected RadioButton.
        See Also:
        sortListByDate(ObservableList, ListView, Path, Path, int), sortListByName(ObservableList, ListView, int)

      • rightSortBy

        public void rightSortBy()
        Sorts right area directory based on selected RadioButton.
        See Also:

      • loadFiles

        public void loadFiles​(java.io.File[] listOfFiles,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> files,
                      java.nio.file.Path pathToDir)
        This method loads files from directory to observableArrayList, which later is given as parameter to ListView.
        Parameters:
        listOfFiles - - list of all files from directory.
        files - - observableArray of files, to which listOfFiles' elements will be added
        pathToDir - - path to current directory

      • keyHandler

        public void keyHandler​(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
        calls createNewDirectory() method when user presses F7 and calls deleteFileOrDirectory() when user presses F8
        Parameters:
        keyEvent - - KeyEvent listener, that listens for pressed key.
        See Also:
        deleteFileOrDirectory(), createNewDirectory()

      • createNewDirectory

        public void createNewDirectory()
        This method is called when user presses F7 on keyboard. It creates a new window in which user has to provide name of the new directory and choose if is meant to be created in left area directory or in right area directory
        See Also:
        CreateDirectory.getFileName(), CreateDirectory.getPath()

      • deleteFileOrDirectory

        public void deleteFileOrDirectory()
        Deletes file/directory (depends on the selected item from list) when user presses F8 on keyboard. The method first figures out which file from which list is going to be deleted, checks if it isn't path to precedent directory, creates a confirmation alert to check if user is sure to delete chosen content. If the user confirms, the method removes file from list(s), calls deleteDirectoryRecursion(Path path) method and sorts both lists by using leftSortBy() and rightSortBy() methods.
        See Also:
        leftSortBy(), rightSortBy(), deleteDirectoryRecursion(Path)

      • deleteDirectoryRecursion

        public void deleteDirectoryRecursion​(java.nio.file.Path path)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Deletes all contents of directory and directory itself. I am not author of this method, SEE! Source of the code:
        Parameters:
        path - - path to file/directory that is going to be deleted.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • copyDir

        public void copyDir​(java.lang.String dirName,
                    int whichPath)
        copies directory from one directory to another directory.
        Parameters:
        dirName - - name of the directory to be copied.
        whichPath - - if whichPath parameter is set to 1, directory from left area directory is copied to right area directory. If parameter is set to 2, directory from right area directory is copied to left area directory.

      • copyFile

        public void copyFile​(java.lang.String fileName,
                     int whichPath)
        copies file from one directory to another.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - name of the file to be copied.
        whichPath - - if whichPath parameter is set to 1, file from left area directory is copied to right area directory. If parameter is set to 2, file from right area directory is copied to left area directory.

      • setLabels

        public void setLabels()
        sets all labels' texts when program is started.
